pr_title: Handle process death during filling a form

timeline.bodyText: The problem here was that if we were in a field-list group and we wanted to get XPath for a question to remember that that question is waiting for an answer it didn't work because we were passing it's index properly like 0,1 for example but then getEvent() (without any parameter) used our current index to return the XPath which in case of field-list groups is the index of the whole group not of that particular question.
timeline.author: grzesiek2010

replies.bodyText: Yeah this just seems cleaner as well!
replies.author: seadowg

timeline.bodyText:
In 5b6ae1a I just removed this check because we nowhere use putBooleanExtra("start", false); so this is always false. Please correct me if i made a mistake.
is it possible that external apps use this for something?
timeline.author: grzesiek2010

replies.bodyText:
I can't find anything on it and it doesn't look like it's documented (looking here) but I'm still a little worried it could be relied on somewhere out there?
We can add a note to QA about this to see if they have any test cases for it. It doesn't look like the change would "break" anything if someone was using it - the user would just end up on the hierarchy.
replies.author: seadowg

replies.bodyText: I removed this change and I'll file a separate issue to discuss it.
replies.author: grzesiek2010

timeline.bodyText: If we are here (just after loading a form) and our index is in form (that mean it was saved and now restored) that means it was caused by process death. I hope there are no other cases :)
timeline.author: grzesiek2010

replies.bodyText:
Could you add more details to the comment here? I'm not sure I follow exactly how we end up with an index in the form in this case but not if I kill the app and then open the form again?
It'd also good to point out here that in the activity death scenario we don't need to reload the form so we don't end up here.
replies.author: seadowg
